intro: Randia hygrophyla, commonly known as the water randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic to ovate in shape, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and are typically white or pale pink, with four to five petals.
